DOC.brief_summary: The purpose of this study is to determine if lenalidomide is a safe and effective treatment for complex regional pain syndrome type 1 (CRPS).
DOC.brief_title: A Study of the Effect of Lenalidamide on Complex Regional Pain Syndrome Type 1
DOC.criteria: 1. Age > or = to 18 years 2. Signed consent form 3. A diagnosis of CRPS type I for at least oneyear duration with unilateral involvement of a distal limb 4. CRPS pain intensity score at least 4 on an 11point PINRS 5. Measurable sural, median sensory, median motor and peroneal motor nerve conductions 6. Women of childbearing potential must have a negative serum or urine pregnancy test within 7 days of starting the study drug. They must agree to use adequate contraceptive methods not including steroidbased contraceptives. They must also agree to have pregnancy tests every 4 weeks while on the study drug.
